intro: Phyllanthus taylorianus, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a small shrub that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, and its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy coating. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with unique morphological features. Phyllanthus taylorianus is also noted for its medicinal uses in traditional African medicine.
